verses.verse: In the six<WH8337> and thirtieth<WH7970> year<WH8141> of the reign<WH4438> of Asa,<WH609> Baasha<WH1201> king<WH4438> of Israel<WH3478> went up<WH5927> against Judah,<WH3063> and built<WH1129> Ramah,<WH7414> that<WH1115> he might not allow<WH5414> anyone to go out<WH3318> or come in<WH935> to Asa<WH609> king<WH4428> of Judah.<WH3063>

Then Asa<WH609> brought out<WH3318> silver<WH3701> and gold<WH2091> out of the treasures<WH214> of the house<WH1004> of Yahweh<WH3068> and of the king<WH4428>'s house,<WH1004> and sent<WH7971> to Ben Hadad<WH1130> king<WH4428> of Syria,<WH758> who lived<WH3427> at Damascus,<WH1834> saying,<WH559>

"Let there be a treaty<WH1285> between me and you,<WH1> as there was between my father and your father.<WH1> Behold,<WH7971> I have sent you silver<WH3701> and gold.<WH2091> Go,<WH3212> break<WH6565> your treaty<WH1285> with Baasha<WH1201> king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> that he may depart from me.<WH5927>"

Ben Hadad<WH1130> listened<WH8085> to king<WH4428> Asa,<WH609> and sent<WH7971> the captains<WH8269> of his armies<WH2428> against the cities<WH5892> of Israel;<WH3478> and they struck<WH5221> Ijon,<WH5859> and Dan,<WH1835> and Abel Maim,<WH66> and all the storage<WH4543> cities<WH5892> of Naphtali.<WH5321>
It happened,<WH1201> when Baasha heard<WH8085> of it,<WH2308> that he left off building<WH1129> Ramah,<WH7414> and let his work<WH4399> cease.<WH7673>

Then Asa<WH609> the king<WH4428> took<WH3947> all Judah;<WH3063> and they carried away<WH5375> the stones<WH68> of Ramah,<WH7414> and its timber,<WH6086> with which Baasha<WH1201> had built;<WH1129> and he built therewith Geba<WH1387> and Mizpah.<WH4709>

At that time<WH6256> Hanani<WH2607> the seer<WH7200> came<WH935> to Asa<WH609> king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> and said<WH559> to him,<WH8172> "Because you have relied on the king<WH4428> of Syria,<WH758> and have not relied<WH8172> on Yahweh<WH3068> your God,<WH430> therefore is the army<WH2428> of the king<WH4428> of Syria<WH758> escaped<WH4422> out of your hand.<WH3027>

Weren't<WH3569> the Ethiopians and the Lubim<WH3864> a huge<WH7230> army,<WH2428> with chariots<WH7393> and horsemen<WH6571> exceeding<WH3966> many?<WH7235> Yet,<WH8172> because you relied on Yahweh,<WH3068> he delivered<WH5414> them into your hand.<WH3027>

For the eyes<WH5869> of Yahweh<WH3068> run back and forth<WH7751> throughout the whole earth,<WH776> to show himself strong<WH2388> in the behalf of them whose heart<WH3824> is perfect<WH8003> toward him.<WH5528> Herein you have done foolishly; for from henceforth<WH6258> you shall have<WH3426> wars.<WH4421>"

Then Asa<WH609> was angry<WH3707> with the seer,<WH7200> and put<WH5414> him in the prison;<WH4115> <WH1004> for he was in a rage<WH2197> with him because of this thing.<WH609> Asa oppressed<WH7533> some of the people<WH5971> at the same time.<WH6256>
Behold,<WH1697> the acts of Asa,<WH609> first<WH7223> and last,<WH314> behold,<WH3789> they are written in the book<WH5612> of the kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> and Israel.<WH3478>

In the thirty<WH7970> - ninth<WH8672> year<WH8141> of his reign<WH4438> Asa<WH609> was diseased<WH2456> in his feet;<WH7272> his disease<WH2483> was exceeding<WH4605> great:<WH2483> yet in his disease he didn't<WH1875> seek Yahweh,<WH3068> but to the physicians.<WH7495>
Asa<WH609> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and died<WH4191> in the one<WH259> and fortieth<WH705> year<WH8141> of his reign.<WH4427>

They buried<WH6912> him in his own tombs,<WH6913> which he had dug<WH3738> out for himself in the city<WH5892> of David,<WH1732> and laid<WH7901> him in the bed<WH4904> which was filled<WH4390> with sweet odors<WH1314> and various kinds<WH2177> of spices prepared<WH7543> by the perfumers<WH4842>' art:<WH4639> and they made<WH8313> a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> burning for him.<WH8316>
